name: df-prds
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7, setvar s8, setvar s9, setvar s10
body: |- wceq(cprds, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, universe, csb(s3, cixp(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)))), csb(s6, cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s3), cv(s3), cixp(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), cfv(chom, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2))))), cun(cun(ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cv(s3)), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s3), cv(s3), cmpt(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), cfv(cplusg, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2)))))), cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s3), cv(s3), cmpt(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), cfv(cmulr, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2))))))), ctp(cop(cfv(csca, cnx), cv(s0)), cop(cfv(cvsca, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cv(s3), cmpt(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cv(s4), cfv(cvsca, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2)))))), cop(cfv(cip, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s3), cv(s3), co(cv(s0), cgsu, cmpt(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), cfv(cip, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2))))))))), cun(ctp(cop(cfv(cts, cnx), cfv(cpt, ccom(ctopn, cv(s1)))), cop(cfv(cple, cnx), copab(s4, s5, wa(wss(cpr(cv(s4), cv(s5)), cv(s3)), wral(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), wbr(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), cfv(cple, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2))))))), cop(cfv(cds, cnx), cmpo(s4, s5, cv(s3), cv(s3), csup(cun(crn(cmpt(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cfv(cv(s4), cv(s2)), cfv(cds, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s5), cv(s2))))), csn(nat0)), cxr, clt)))), cpr(cop(cfv(chom, cnx), cv(s6)), cop(cfv(cco, cnx), cmpo(s7, s8, cxp(cv(s3), cv(s3)), cv(s3), cmpo(s9, s10, co(cv(s8), cv(s6), cfv(c2nd, cv(s7))), cfv(cv(s6), cv(s7)), cmpt(s2, cdm(cv(s1)), co(cfv(cv(s9), cv(s2)), co(cop(cfv(cfv(c1st, cv(s7)), cv(s2)), cfv(cfv(c2nd, cv(s7)), cv(s2))), cfv(cco, cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s8), cv(s2))), cfv(cv(s10), cv(s2))))))))))))))
comment: Define a structure product. This can be a product of groups, rings, modules, or ordered topological fields; any unused components will have garbage in them but this is usually not relevant for the purpose of inheriting the structures present in the factors. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 15-Jun-2019.)
